channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Save the world then go get piste -- Mid-level Perl developer and ski-master in Sevenoaks, Kent

item.description: Your average Perl development role, but with a personal recommendation from me that your colleagues are great people, and that Iâ€™d be surprised if you didnâ€™t enjoy your time there

item.title: Junior Perl developer needed to help a charity and giving-focused team in Kent, UK
item.description: This might be a unique chance to get trained by awesome developers in a wonderful working environment while adding your contribution to the world being a better place!

item.description: RPerl representing first time at any Perl Conference and shares their experience.

item.description: I had the pleasure to attend his talk. If you are new to Perl 6 then I recommend his talk.

item.description: Brilliant take on The Perl Conference in Glasgow. Must read for everyone.

item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Python: The Programmer's Lingua Franca
item.description: ActiveState released the white paper on the subject. Download the paper and read it.

item.title: Marpa and combinator parsing 2
item.description: Jeffrey second part of the series 'Marpa and combinator parsing'. A very detailed description and must read if you like the subject.

item.title: msys2 is good environment to use Mojolicious in Windows
item.description: Yuki showing why msys2 is good environment to use Mojolicious. It is written in Japanese, please use Google translator.

item.title: 3 Traits Young Professionals Need To Succeed In Life and Career
item.description: A useful guide for any young professional.

item.description: Yanick released new version fixing signatures in ::Command::Clone.

item.description: My journey of daily CPAN uploads.

item.title: Git commands to keep a fork up to date
item.description: Self explanatory blog showing how to keep a fork up to date.

item.title: I love git log
item.description: Another blog showing the power of Git. I am always surprised by the hidden gem of Git.

item.title: How lazy am I?
item.description: Are you a lazy programmer? Olaf has an answer for you. If you want to know then please read his blog.

item.title: Make your business stick! StickerYou has a discount for all Perl Weekly subscribers
item.description: StickerYou is your one-stop shop to make your business stick. You can create custom stickers, labels, decals, magnets, and more in any size, shape, and order quantity. Whether youâ€™re a freelancer or aspiring entrepreneur, StickerYou makes it easy to create personal brand awareness. Use code PERL10 at checkout for a 10% discount.

item.title: #370 - TPCiG - Sweet Memory
item.description:
Last week belonged to The Perl Conference in Glasgow in general. There are many blog sharing the experience appeared in the last few days. I would like to mention one particular blog by a first timer, Sam Anderson. If you haven't read it by now then I would suggest you should read it now.

If you missed the event then don't worry you can still watch the videos available on youtube.

Day 1: cPanel Theatre, Pirum Theatre and Zoopla Theatre.

Day 2: cPanel Theatre, Pirum Theatre and Zoopla Theatre.

Day 3: cPanel Theatre, Pirum Theatre and Zoopla Theatre.

I would also like to remind everyone who attended The Perl Conference in Glasgow to submit the survey without any further delay. Look for email from Barbie in your inbox with the personalised link for the survey. It is important for the organiser to know what went wrong and what went well. At the same time, the speakers get to know if there is any scope for improvement.

Enjoy reading this week newsletter.
